name: And That's The End of That Quiz | Biblical Quotes | 10 Questions

questions.text: Where would you find this verse: "And they shall go forth, and look upon the carcases of the men that have transgressed against me: for their worm shall not die, neither shall their fire be quenched; and they shall be an abhorring unto all flesh"?
questions.explanation:
Isaiah.

	This verse is found in Isaiah 66:24. Isaiah was one of the major prophets. His book is filled with prophecy about the coming Messiah. Some scholars believe Isaiah was written by two authors, however, most believe it was written by one, Isaiah.

questions.text: Where would you find the verse that says, "And for his diet, there was a continual diet given him of the king of Babylon, every day a portion until the day of his death, all the days of his life"?
questions.explanation:
Jeremiah.

	This verse is found in Jeremiah 52:34. Jeremiah was a major prophet. He was also known as the weeping prophet. In his book, Jeremiah warns the people of Judah that if they continue to turn away from God, their city will fall to Babylon.

questions.text: In which book of the Bible would you find a verse that says, "These are the commandments and the judgments, which the Lord commanded by the hand of Moses unto the children of Israel in the plains of Moab by Jordan near Jericho"?
questions.explanation:
Numbers.

	This verse can be found in Numbers 36:13. Numbers is part of the books of Moses, which consist of the first five books of the Bible. They are also known as the Pentateuch, which is the Greek word meaning five books. The book of Numbers is where most of the 40 years of wandering in the wilderness takes place.

questions.text: Where would one find this verse: "From henceforth let no man trouble me: for I bear in my body the marks of the Lord Jesus"?
questions.explanation:
Galatians.

	This verse can be found in Galatians 6:17. Galatians is one of the many letters written by Paul. Paul is very angry in this letter because the people of Galatia have not been very faithful to God.

questions.text: In what book is this verse found? "To God only wise, be glory through Jesus Christ for ever. Amen."
questions.explanation:
Romans.

	This verse can be found in Romans 16:27. Romans is the first of the many letters written by Paul. Romans is the longest of the letters. This is the book of the Bible which Martin Luther was reading when he started the Reformation, in which "faith alone" was a key component.

questions.text: The following verse is the last verse of more than one book in the King James Bible: "The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen."
questions.explanation:
True.

	This verse can be found in Philippians, II Thessalonians and Revelation 22:21. Many of the other letters have similar endings. The verse says in Philippians 4:23, II Thessalonians 3:18, and Revelation 22:21, "The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen."

questions.text: In which book of the Bible do we find the verse that says, "For the cloud of the Lord was upon the tabernacle by day, and fire was on it by night, in the sight of all the house of Israel, throughout all their journeys"?
questions.explanation:
Exodus.

	This verse is found in Exodus 40:38. Exodus is the second book of Moses which deals with the Hebrews leaving Egypt after having been slaves for hundreds of years. This cloud and fire talked about in the verse was God's way of guiding the Hebrews as they went through the desert toward the Promised Land.

questions.text: Where would you find the verse, "With all his reign and his might, and the times that went over him, and over Israel, and over all the kingdoms of the countries"?
questions.explanation:
I Chronicles.

	This is found in I Chronicles 29:30. There are two books of Chronicles and they are part of the history of the Jews.

questions.text: Where would you find the verse that says, "Let every thing that hath breath praise the Lord. Praise ye the Lord"?
questions.explanation:
Psalms.

	It is found in Psalm 150:6. Psalms is one of the books of poetry and the longest book in the Bible. King David is given credit for writing the majority of the psalms. The book of Psalms is a book of praises to God.

questions.text: Where would you find the verse that says, "Which some professing have erred concerning the faith. Grace be with thee. Amen"?
questions.explanation:
I Timothy.

	This verse can be found in I Timothy 6:21. Timothy was a friend and coworker of Paul's. Paul wrote these two letters to Timothy to encourage him. The letter contains instruction on how the church should function and what the role of the pastor is.
